revised_title: The Effect of Soil pH on Cabbage Disease and Control Measures
tldr: The author conducted experiments to understand the effect of soil pH on the development of a cabbage disease caused by Plasmodiophora. They found that the disease was more developed in soil with an acid reaction and was checked by the presence of alkalies like lime. The author also highlighted the importance of preventing the growth of weeds that are susceptible to the same disease.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Pathology
